input_text:
Job Title: Sr. Customer Marketing Specialist, Defense

Location: Clearwater, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

This is an exciting role inside Honeywell Aerospace Technologies Customer Marketing team. Reporting to the Aerospace Americas Customer Marketing Sr. Director and matrix reporting to the Global Defense & Space Customer Marketing Director, you will design and execute strategic Customer Marketing initiatives by planning and executing campaigns and advancing digital, social, and marketing automation techniques. In addition, you will be helping shape our presence at Defense & Space industry tradeshows and events and working on related projects.

The Customer Marketing Sr Specialist will be responsible for developing and executing campaigns that drive customer engagement, loyalty, and advocacy. This role will work closely with cross-functional teams to drive business growth, focusing on Defense & Space and Channel Partners as required.

In short, we are looking for a bright, competitive, selfless, and hardworking individual who brings a commitment to excellence in the workplace and a bias toward action, results, and innovation. We value diversity, integrity, and a “win and have fun” work approach through Honeywell’s six behaviors. We are a world-class B2B marketing team that collectively strive to be a company of thinkers, doers, dreamers, and makers – join us!

Key Responsibilities

Work collaboratively with the Aerospace Technologies Strategic Business Units (SBUs), regional and Customer marketing teams to identify those products, segments, and accounts which will offer a meaningful return on investment if targeted through campaignsDesign Marketing campaigns which will target and nurture contacts in an efficient way and generate well-qualified leads for the sales teams to follow up on, choosing the appropriate channels and techniquesWork closely with the Marketo and SFDC focal and experts in the organization for the technical execution, as well as tracking and measuringWork closely with the web team to enable comprehensive analytics, measurement and tracking of lead activity on relevant webpages and related assetsWork internally with key stakeholders in product management, sales and customer marketing to develop unique requirements for each campaign and execute against those requirementsBe an ambassador -- and key protector -- of our brand in all work, including acting as a reviewer /approver of content.Develop clear project plans, and effectively manage the budget, for each campaignWork closely with other digital marketing, brand, creative, event, social and campaign marketersImprove lead capturing and opt-in performance at events and trade showsSome travel required. Approximately 30%

U.s. Person Requirements

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status.

YOU MUST HAVE

3+ years of experience in customer marketing or a related fieldProven track record of developing and executing successful customer marketing campaigns and programsStrong analytical skills and ability to use data to drive decision-makingUnderstanding of Aerospace, Defense and Space industries and main players and productsExcellent communication, collaboration, organizational and project management skillsComfort in operating across international borders, diplomatic capability to successfully interface with international culturesAbility to collaborate with the legal team and knowledge of data privacy regulationsSound knowledge of marketing automation tools such as Marketo or PardotProficiency in EnglishThe ability to meet deadlines, work under demanding conditions and problem solve in times of crisis with a sense of urgency, passion…while having fun!

WE VALUE

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related fieldExcellent communication, collaboration, organizational and project management skillsDeadline disciplined, and ability to excel in often vague or ambiguous areas.Capable of working on many projects simultaneously with strong execution, inter-personal and project management skillsAbility to work in a large, dynamic, highly matrixed, and often ambiguous environmentsHigh-energy, creative, resourceful, and results-driven self-starter

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD227750Category: MarketingLocation: 13350 US Hwy 19 N,Clearwater,Florida,33764,United StatesExemptDue to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status.

Marketing (GLOBAL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
